citations.narrative:
The facility has an adult non-releasable Floridian manatee, Guacara, housed singly in the enclosure labeled 24K pool.
The Center has been offered to long-term house another non-releasable Floridian manatee, named Cayo, presently at
Zoo Tampa. It is the attending veterinarian's professional opinion that "Guacara" should have the companionship of a
compatible animal of the same or biologically related species. Manatees are semi-social animals and do better medically
and psychologically when they are housed in pairs or groups. Marine mammals, whenever know to be primarily social in
the wild, must be housed in their primary enclosure with at least one compatible animal of the same or biologically related
species.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
Additional Inspectors:
MARIO MERCADO, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.109  Repeat
   
Separation. 
The facility has an adult non-releasable Floridian manatee, Guacara, housed singly in the enclosure labeled 24K pool. 
The Center has been offered to long-term house another non-releasable Floridian manatee, named Cayo, presently at 
Zoo Tampa. It is the attending veterinarian's professional opinion that "Guacara" should have the companionship of a 
compatible animal of the same or biologically related species. Manatees are semi-social animals and do better medically 
and psychologically when they are housed in pairs or groups. Marine mammals, whenever know to be primarily social in 
the wild, must be housed in their primary enclosure with at least one compatible animal of the same or biologically related 
species. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
MARIO MERCADO, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
